label: 祈年祭
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: rites held before the commencement of the planting season to petition the deities for a bountiful harvest. It was one of the rites prescribed for annual performance by the Law on Shrines of the ritsuryō codes. As one element, offerings were sent to cult centers throughout the realm, thereby linking the tennō to such centers, their deities, and their people. [律令、天皇]
